message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $100. It's a rare opportunity to get a top-notch item at a fixed price. If you're interested, please let me know, and I'll hand it over to you.
I'll take it, but can you explain why you're selling it for such a low price?

I'm glad you're satisfied with the first purchase! I'm selling this next product at the same price of $100, but I want to assure you that it's a different item from the first one. It's also a high-quality product, and I'm confident you'll appreciate its unique features. However, I'm willing to offer you a special deal: if you buy this product, I'll throw in a personalized guarantee that it's indeed high-quality, and I'll provide you with a detailed description of its features. This way, you can be even more confident in your purchase.
I'm not sure I need a guarantee, I'll just take my chances

I understand your decision, and I respect it. Let me ask you this: if you were to know for certain that the product is high-quality, would you be willing to pay $100 for it? I'm not asking for a commitment, just a thought experiment. This will help me understand your valuation of high-quality products.
I still don't need a guarantee, and I'll pass on this one

I understand you're being cautious. This product is actually a different item from the previous ones. I'm offering it to you at the same price of $100, but I want to be transparent with you: I've had some issues with this product's performance in the past, and I'm not entirely confident in its quality. If you're willing to take a chance, I'll give you a 10% discount, making it $90. It's a risk, but it might be a good opportunity to get a product at a lower price.

It's a product that I've already sold to other customers, and they've been very happy with it. This way, you'll get more value for your money, and I'll be able to move on to the next product.
I'm not interested in buying a complementary product, I'll just stick to the original offer

I'll take the product, but I'm only doing it because I think it might be the last high-quality one you have
